titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Westgate Tenants Association Records TAM.521
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-06-23T14:03-0400

change.item: Edited by Bonnie Gordon to reflect updated administrative information

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

physdesc.extent: in 1 record carton and 1 manuscript box

did.abstract: The Westgate Tenants Association represents the tenants of a "Mitchell-Lama" built housing project on New York City's Upper West Side, and in particular struggles to maintain rent stabilization against the project's new owner, who opted out of the Mitchell-Lama" program and seeks to achieve market-rate rents in the project. The collection contains correspondence, minutes, flyers, newsletters, clippings, research files, and government reports related to housing issues.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Westgate Tenants Association represents the tenants of a "Mitchell-Lama" built housing project on New York City's Upper West Side, and in particular struggles to maintain rent stabilization against the project's new owner, who opted out of the Mitchell-Lama" program and seeks to achieve market-rate rents in the project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, minutes, flyers, newsletters, clippings, research files, and government reports related to housing issues.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the Westgate Tenants Association, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2009. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Jean Green Dorsey on behalf of the Westgate Tenants Association in 2009. The accession number associated with this collection is 2009.093.
